channel.title: Deception [ getting online ]
channel.description: okay so im using deception spawn server with tokhaar etc, and i cant seem to put it online using my VPS im using CentOS SSH client and all of my other RSPS work but not this i changed the port to 43594 and everything else...it seems lots of people have had this problem so i was wondering if anyone knew how to do it? thanks.

item.title: Deception [ getting online ]
item.dc:creator: @Nice_Boots Nice Boots
item.description:
@Nice_Boots wrote:

hmm…it should be working your using “deception” i think some people had some problems with that im not sure how they fixed it though try looking around

Read full topic

item.title: Deception [ getting online ]
item.dc:creator: @sw3ldn sw3ldn
item.description:
@sw3ldn wrote:

okay i just made my RSPS server run compatible with all JDK versions and its still not working -.- it says accepting connections on port 43594 and everything anything else i could try ?

Read full topic

item.title: Deception [ getting online ]
item.dc:creator: @pro_banana pro banana
item.description:
@pro_banana wrote:

Then upgrade to jre7? or modify your runner to work with jre6 if it’s possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Deception [ getting online ]
item.dc:creator: @sw3ldn sw3ldn
item.description:
@sw3ldn wrote:

idk this might be the problem but whenever i try running the server using java 6 it gives me an error but when i use java 7 it lets me run it could that be the problem cause my VPS only has java 6

Read full topic

item.title: Deception [ getting online ]
item.dc:creator: @pro_banana pro banana
item.description:
@pro_banana wrote:

sw3ldn:

yeah i did change the bat files its linux compatible cause its running perfectly fine its just when when i do “killall java” it says no process killed which means it was never online something in the source is like blocking it.

  1. Make sure java is installed correctly.
  2. convert .bat to .sh
  3. When converting to .sh make sure you use the correct file names since it’s case sensetive.

If all fails -> google it.

Read full topic

item.title: Deception [ getting online ]

item.description:

yeah i did change the bat files its linux compatible cause its running perfectly fine its just when when i do “killall java” it says no process killed which means it was never online something in the source is like blocking it.

item.dc:creator: @pro_banana pro banana
item.description:
@pro_banana wrote:

You might want to change the .bat file so it can run on linux. if that’s the problem?
